title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The first point is earned only for correctly implicitly differentiating 2 y 2 −6=y sin x. Responses may use alternative notations for dy dx , such as y ′ .

The second point may not be earned without the first point.

It is sufficient to present dy dx ( 4y−sin x )=y cos x to earn the second point, provided that there are no subsequent errors.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

Any correct tangent line equation will earn the point. No supporting work is required. Simplification of the slope value is not required.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes the criteria below.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The first point is earned by any of dy dx =0, y cos x 4y−sin x =0, or cos x=0.

If additional “correct” x -values are considered outside of the given domain, the response must commit to only x= π 2 to earn the second point. Any presented y -values, correct or incorrect, are not considered for the second point.

Entering with x= π 2 does not earn the first point, earns the second point, and is eligible for the third point. The third point is earned for finding y=2. The coordinates do not have to be presented as an ordered pair.

The third point is not earned with additional points present unless the response commits to the correct point.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes all three of the criteria below.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The first point is earned for an attempt to use the quotient rule (or product rule) to find d 2 y d x 2 .

The second point is earned for correctly finding d 2 y d x 2 and evaluating to find that d 2 y d x 2 <0 at ( π 2 ,  2 ). The explicit value of − 2 7 or the equivalent does not need to be reported, but any reported values must be correct in order to earn this point.

The third point can be earned without the second point by reaching a consistent conclusion based on the reported sign of a nonzero value of d 2 y d x 2 obtained utilizing dy dx =0.

Imports: A response is eligible to earn all 3 points in part (d) with a point of the form ( π 2 ,  k ) with k>0, imported from part (c).
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes all three of the criteria below.
